intro: Pulicaria graeca, commonly known as Greek tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and silver-green foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional herbal remedies. Pulicaria graeca is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
